reviewText:
First things first, this game works fine for me in Windows 10.

With an odd mixture of German and English text, this game seems like a half-hearted attempt to reach a larger audience than it would otherwise have.  The tutorial is minimal, but I did pick the gist of the game quickly enough I suppose.   The graphics look fairly dated and generic, but are serviceble enough I suppose.

The game play was the weakest part for me.  Basically the player is tasked with picking up vehicles with various thought-balloon wants' and then dropping them at the appropiate venue.  Varous venues can be built
date: but several require the currency of "Bonuses" as well as in game money.  This one got very boring and repetitous for me very quickly.\n\nOddly
recommended: that doesn't mean it's easy.   One has to periodically restock one's venues
hoursPlayed: which is fair enough.  The problem is that I even dragging and dropping as quickly as I could
voteText: I found the restock fee negated any profit I was turning.   So I can add the word "fustrating" to the list of things that describe this game.\n\nI got it during a 40% sale
helpfulPercent: for the price $1.79.  I don't have high hopes for games that run that cheap
votesHelpful: so I guess I can say it's a fair value
votesTotal: if drag and drop games appeal to you.  For my part though
votesFunny: I wish I had given this one a pass."

reviewText:
A time management game should keep things interesting by adding new challenges or the occasional random bonus, but this game doesn't do that. I only managed to play the first four levels before I completely lost interest but every single level was the same... red car? Drag it on the red icon. Black car? Drag it on the black icon, repeat ad infinitum.
As you progress you need to build more and more stations (colours) to drag the cars on to, and there you have the game. You're going up against a time limit and have to juggle the non-stop drag&drop of cars against the need to upgrade existing structures, build new ones, and buy resources.

The story is told through comic panels in awkward English translated from German but is ultimately uninteresting.

Stay away from this one, there are far better time management games on Steam.
voteText: 9 of 10 people (90%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText: An idea with potential, poorly executed here. The art is okay, but the interface and gameplay choice for this theme just doesn't work well. Even if you are a fan of rapid drag and drop gameplay, you'll probably still be disappointed here, as the interface causes you to grab the wrong vehicle, or not accept your placement of it as you drop. Construction does pause the game, but it jumps out of pause as you as you click something, which is quite disorienting.\n\nI picked it up on sale for less than a dollar, thinking perhaps the few reviews were not a clear picture, but I should have listened to them, and I recommend you do as well. Skip this.

reviewText: Game is not supported by current gen OS.  When brought up in Task Manager, it says that it's not responding.  Won't run.
